pullrequest.title: Remove plain 'qwt' leaving only 'qwt-qt5', since it links to Qt4 version.

content.raw:
unfortunately `qwt` is used in homebrew on OSX. I think we could tweak this patch and add a platform check to set the name of the qwt library accordingly, e.g.

~~~
diff -r 2e71e0091b49 cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
--- a/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake	Fri Jan 20 23:58:49 2017 +0000
+++ b/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake	Tue Jan 24 15:27:47 2017 -0800
@@ -761,7 +761,12 @@
   PATH_SUFFIXES qwt qwt5
 )
 
-find_library(QWT_LIBRARY NAMES qwt-qt5 qwt PATHS
+SET(QWT_LIB_NAME "qwt-qt5")
+if (APPLE)
+  SET(QWT_LIB_NAME "qwt")
+endif()
+
+find_library(QWT_LIBRARY NAMES ${QWT_LIB_NAME} PATHS
~~~
content.html:
unfortunately qwt is used in homebrew on OSX. I think we could tweak this patch and add a platform check to set the name of the qwt library accordingly, e.g.

diff -r 2e71e0091b49 cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
--- a/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake    Fri Jan 20 23:58:49 2017 +0000
+++ b/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake    Tue Jan 24 15:27:47 2017 -0800
@@ -761,7 +761,12 @@
   PATH_SUFFIXES qwt qwt5
 )

-find_library(QWT_LIBRARY NAMES qwt-qt5 qwt PATHS
+SET(QWT_LIB_NAME "qwt-qt5")
+if (APPLE)
+  SET(QWT_LIB_NAME "qwt")
+endif()
+
+find_library(QWT_LIBRARY NAMES ${QWT_LIB_NAME} PATHS

pullrequest.title: Remove plain 'qwt' leaving only 'qwt-qt5', since it links to Qt4 version.

content.raw: Ah, thought something like that might be true. Too bad.  Well, to be fair, it does work on Xenial, it just tripped me up rather badly.  It could be left as-is to be safe.  It's probably more correct to have `if(Linux) set(QWT_LIB_NAME "qwt-qt5")`, but just checking them both is probably safer in the general case.
content.html: Ah, thought something like that might be true. Too bad. Well, to be fair, it does work on Xenial, it just tripped me up rather badly. It could be left as-is to be safe. It's probably more correct to have if(Linux) set(QWT_LIB_NAME "qwt-qt5"), but just checking them both is probably safer in the general case.

pullrequest.title: Remove plain 'qwt' leaving only 'qwt-qt5', since it links to Qt4 version.

content.raw:
Sure checking `Linux` seems like a better option as I think Windows probably also uses `qwt` and not `qwt-qt5`. Would you mind updating the pull request with those changes? 

Thanks for fixing this!
content.html:
Sure checking Linux seems like a better option as I think Windows probably also uses qwt and not qwt-qt5. Would you mind updating the pull request with those changes?

Thanks for fixing this!
